website_summaries.verdict: For web browsing and using apps, the Chromebook is hard to beat. An inexpensive model for those who need the basics on the go.
pros: Portable and lightweight, this sleek Chromebook can travel anywhere
Quad core brings good speed when coupled with excellent battery life
cons: Speakers are located underneath, muffling the sound

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable price and battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Fanless, so it's quiet. 4 GB of RAM helps with having many tabs open at once. The fading color on the case looks pretty cool, and the price is unbeatable. 10+ hours of battery life. Perfect computer to take on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Lucángeli Obes

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you know how long that version of Chrome is supported
customer_reviews.text: I just found out that Chrome will not be supporting this version of Chrome after June. I bought this ChromeBook in 2017 and now it is a throw away because you cannot update the operating system. So if you buy a ChromeBook it is only good for the maximum of 6 years. There is a place on the web that will tell you how long that ChromeBook is supported. I would never buy another ChromeBook. I can see where it is not supported after a time, but there is no way to update it. I have gone back to my laptop and installed ubuntu. At least when a version is no long supported, I can update to a new version.
customer_reviews.author: J. Amend

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent laptop, I will never use Windows again. Fast, lightweight, 13 hours without recharging, zero hours waiting for an upgrade to install each week, no viruses, no blue screens, no cryptic error messages, I can do all my work without buy any expensive packages (including Office) and a price fully affordable for everyone. Thanks, Google and thanks, ASUS!!
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo D. Zayas Cañedo

customer_reviews.title: Little demon!
customer_reviews.text: This computer is a little demon. Im a new photographer and though it's not photoshop.. I use an app from chrome for editing my photos. It's quick, small, and nicely designed. It doesn't have a cd drive, but I honestly dont miss it as I can put all my photos on a USB drive or take the card to walmart. All in all, I'd recommend this to anyone who was looking for a simple easy to use machine for websurfing and all your general every day tasks.
customer_reviews.author: sarah noble

customer_reviews.title: Nice computer!
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review on this computer. It has served me well for over 2 months. I prefer the chromebooks since they seem to be more resistant to viruses. But from what I'm reading that won't last long. It is very fast for what it has built in. No problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Charlesqc2

customer_reviews.title: It came highly recommended and was $100 cheaper than the same machine on ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I don't generally do product reviews. Secondly, I'm a Mac guy. That being said; I wanted a separate computer for my real estate business and gave this ASUS a shot. It came highly recommended and was $100 cheaper than the same machine on ebay. This machine has got to be one of my all time best purchases. It's light. It's fast. When others are complaining about wifi strength, I' zipping right along. 12-13 hour battery life with a couple hour charge. 10 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: himdog

customer_reviews.title: a Chromebook seemed to be my best option. My 11-year-old daughter has a Chromebook and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Macbook Air I bought in 2011 that's getting a little long in the tooth so I decided it was time to get a new machine. A new Air was not in my budget and since I don't buy Windows machines anymore (too buggy), a Chromebook seemed to be my best option. My 11-year-old daughter has a Chromebook and is quite happy with it so I decided to take the plunge. So far I am quite happy. Yes, I have probably sold my soul to Google, but is that worse than selling my soul to Microsoft?
customer_reviews.author: Heather N.

customer_reviews.title: A fresh new experience without the constant ads and updates of Windows, reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: If you're a Chromebook user already, want to learn a new way of doing things, or have some other special reason for getting one of these, do so. It runs the Chrome OS (same guys who gave us Google Chrome) so it's very, very focused on those products. There's even a whole new universe of programs to try. I, for one, like the simplicity and not giving my money to M$oft for once, and like the 11-inch form factor. But if you're used to Windows, the prices have pretty much evened out so think carefully since this is quite a different experience. (This written by someone whose computer experience goes back to TRS-80s.)
customer_reviews.author: al h

customer_reviews.title: Great computer, beware the charger.
customer_reviews.text: It's not a bad little computer, it does light web browsing and text editing and even programming just fine. The issue I have is that the chargers are Garbage. The connector is flimsy and bends and breaks all too easily. I've already had to order a replacement, and I haven't even owned the computer for a year. And the replacement charger is broken too now, at the connection point to the computer because it's cheap and flimsy! The computer works just fine and is great, but the chargers are flimsy and cheap and need to be built stronger or something. I can't believe I have to drop another $15 on a replacement charger that Asus doesn't even sell themselves!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna A.

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook C201 Review
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item in August 2016, had good battery life, screen is small 11" diagonal measurement, light weight, but only lasted 31 months before the touchpad pointer went out. Originally thought the problem was a Google update, but a lot of reports on touchpad problems leads me to the conclusion this is a hardware problem. The Chromebook was only $200 with tax but I expected to get 4 to 5 years out of it, so I am somewhat disappointed. Last ditch effort is a powerwash to reset to original specs. Update: powerwash worked! Touchpad pointer now works correctly after the powerwash.
customer_reviews.author: Jack W. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: No! When you pay full price for a new item you expect it to be new. This item had pre-entered social media dating sites. It had different pages throughout the history and also pre-filled data.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and finish for <$200!
customer_reviews.text: There are a few shortcomings of the Chrome OS. It can't connect directly to my non-internet capable printer, and can't handle Skype video, but other than that, it does just about everything I need it to. This fit and finish on this device is very good. I can't believe it cost <$200. The keyboard has much better action than many much more expensive laptops. The viewing angle on the screen is very broad and colors are very good. I don't stream a lot of video on my Chromebook, but when I do I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: BEST BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I simply can't understand how anyone can write a negative review about this product! For this price what do you possibly expect? Name 1 product that can you purchase for this price that can be better than this Chromebook? My high school son has been using this for over a month now and tosses it around in his backpack and quite honestly, I didn't think it would last this long! We are all mac users and fell in love with this thing! For this price, this is a steal! I'm thrilled with this purchase. It is super fast and quite honestly is better than any other pc I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: online-shopping-addict

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good for Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Apple guy, but I wanted to get a small laptop for the family without breaking the bank. I love Chrome and have always been interested in Chromebooks, but never wanted to spend a lot of money to get a Chromebook with decent hardware. I was pleasantly surprised by this unit, it works great for the Chromebook consumer use case. Google apps, YouTube, Netflix, everything worked well. The trackpad and keyboard had a surprisingly good feel to it considering the price. It's no MacBook, but for 10% of the price, it's a great bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Powers

customer_reviews.title: Above-average budget chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Holds its charge extremely well, keyboard feels awesome considering its price point, and performs like a champ. Only real downside (and where its price shows) is the screen viewing angle. If it's going to be your primary computer, you may want to possibly look into spending a little more for something with an IPS display. Otherwise, it's probably one of the best price/performance ratios you'll find in a chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Greg LeClair

customer_reviews.title: Very light and convenient, good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a portable laptop that would be convenient to carry to classes and this works well. It gets the basics done, such as internet browsing and note typing, so it's useful for college. Downside is that it doesn't use Windows so I often find myself having to convert Google docs when I need to turn in assignments. Paint job is also of dubious quality, the colored part started chipping in less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: This laptop has amazing battery life
customer_reviews.text: This laptop has amazing battery life, thats the huge upside. And not only does it last a long time but charges fully in about an hour and a half for another 13 hours of streaming. Ive been UP and DOWN the market looking for good battery life and here it is guys. The only down side to this little badboy is it could be slightly faster when processing tons of tabs while streaming. But hey, i cant complain with the marathon battery life behind it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Entre, LLC Customer Service

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very good for a low-end Chromebook, and it gets the job done. Some nits to pick: the trackpad isn't nearly as good as my HP Chromebook, and I don't like the feel of the case. It also seems to be slower than my older HP despite having more RAM. Love the portability of the smaller size and the battery lasts pretty much all day so you aren't stuck sitting near an outlet. Great for kids - no worries about losing data if it gets lost or damaged, and cheap enough to just buy another if something goes wrong. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Asus Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Chromebook for just a couple days, and so far, I like using it. I'm definitely going to need a mouse, because I just can't manage the narrow scroll bar on the right side of the screen. I am disappointed that I can't download apps from the Google Play Store, however. I guess this particular Asus model doesn't work with Google Play apps, only Chrome Web Store apps, and the apps I want aren't in the Chrome Web Store, or at least I can't find them.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Obsessed

customer_reviews.title: Super fast, small, easily packed for trips, great quality, remember there is no internal storage
customer_reviews.text: I love this little computer. It's FAST and easily packed away. Great keyboard, never any glitches. One thing to realize though, there is no storage memory on this computer. It's just great for surfing the Internet, email etc..... I use an external hard drive and connect it for storage purposes. Easy to save on Google Drive as well. Great value and high quality computer. So easy to travel with too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Viking28

customer_reviews.title: This laptop is great for notetaking in class
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is great for notetaking in class. The battery is long enough to last at least 4 classes during a day. And the start up is super fast. It's really light too, a lot lighter than my textbooks. Two cons: But for some reason I can't type simplified Chinese on chrome os, only English character will show despite I changed the keyboard input and everything. Similar to windows 10 os, in chrome os you really have to dig if you want to find information such as hardware specification or MAC code. Overall this laptop is great for regular students. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kellywu123

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this Chromebook. I was going to purchase a traditional laptop to supplement my Mac desktop, but realized I really just needed something with internet access other than my phone. It is lightweight, compact and perfect for travel. And it's just so PRETTY! Would 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: F. Irek

customer_reviews.title: Great portable and fast Chromebook.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Chromebook as I wanted a laptop with a long life battery that was light and portable that I could carry around the house easily. I've been using it for a week now, and I have to say I love it. Pros: True long life battery (10+ hours), I use it all day without needing to charge it. Responsive touchpad, easy to use keyboard. Good resolution and instant! on. Cons: Not a true con as it's really a preference, but I have larger hands and the keyboard is a little small for my hands. Overall I'd highly recommend it for someone who is looking for a fast and portable Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Bill_shops_too_much

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD !!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it very much, It's thin and elegant, I had never use Chrome Program on my computer before, but when I tried it, It's fast and you do not need a anti virus, ASUS has a good reputation, and good design too, I use this one to travel anywhere, so I can pay a bill where ever I am in the World. The size 11.6 inches is very handy to go travel, it's very light and good expensive looking ( people think the price over thousand, but in fact only over hundred)
customer_reviews.author: amagus

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a college or high school student
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product I was kind of sketchy about buying it because it's a chromebook but I'm impressed I didn't find anything wrong with the shipping and packaging it's super super light that's one big plus I like taking it to school As I said this laptop is probably good for a college student or high school Cool laptop !
customer_reviews.author: esmeralda

customer_reviews.title: But I love it. It's super light
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tiny!! But I love it. It's super light, and it being Google works perfect for me. I will be using it for my masters program and wanted something I could throw in my purse and head to the coffee shop and that wouldn't die after an hour. The other reviews say it has a long battery life, so I look forward to testing it. So far so good. If all goes well we will but another one for my husband to have his own.
customer_reviews.author: MissBee

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this brand
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box the computer, after being charged, just kept shutting off. Could not re-boot without the screen flashing numerous times. I've had two other previous chromebooks from two other manufacturers. This isn't normal. Have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Floss

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Got this for an aunt that basically only needed internet access and wanted to play some games. Its basically a large smartphone that can't make phone calls, as far as overall "power" goes. But, its more than sufficient for browsing any website, social media, for those addictive computer games, and so on. Very lightweight, easy to use, easy to set up, and it runs smooth and quick. I enjoy that you can use some google apps as needed, google docs for example, instead of a ton of memory being used up by the microsoft suite or similar software. Its not a powerhouse, you can't run memory heavy Steam games or something, but its a nice machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: cheep device for watching videos online
customer_reviews.text: I would prefer a real laptop over this any day. Its light weight... but in terms of functionality and speed, its pretty disappointing. Always online gets in the way, there are sometimes documents don't save. I like the physical design of the laptop, but the OS and internal hardware aren't really enticing. If you're just using it to shop or watch videos online then it technically works. But I would definitely prefer pencil and paper than working on the chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Moore

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value. I would recommend it! Go for the 4gb model for sure!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little machine! I bought this for my Dad as he mainly just browses the web, checks email, and does some light writing and stuff. I set it all up for him and here are my impression so far: -Screen quality is sharp and bright. Viewing angles are decent. -Smooth and fluid with the 4gb of ram -Processing power seems perfectly adequate for browsing and videos -Build quality and keyboard are surprisingly good! -Super light weight and the battery life is awesome. Cons: -Haven't found any real drawbacks yet. It's an awesome machine at the price. Definitely go for the 4gb model though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G.

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for children after "supervised users" removal
customer_reviews.text: This was a great option for a young child to do homework with, but then Google bricked it by removing "supervised users" recently. Google's suggestion is "family link" but that is only available for android devices, which Chromebooks are not. Other than that, the hardware is decent, and performance is snappy.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Astronomer

customer_reviews.title: Basic but nice!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little laptop for the price! I'm only using for basic things like surfing the web, watching Netflix and basic card games.
customer_reviews.author: T. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: This was for a friend's husband (computer challenged) and he absolutely loves it. Can't say enough. The OS has built-in security. It's fast and responsive. Great battery life. Web cam. Unbeatable value. Better than any PC laptop and I mean that. I know it doesn't have MS Office (who uses that pig anymore anyway?) or much storage but if all you do is surf, email, Skype etc. and the odd document then this is all you need. I havd a friend ask what mac laptop to buy. He was going to blow $1500 for somersetting this $200 chrome would do probably better. Sucker!
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Runs slowly, hard to recommend
customer_reviews.text: Two issues with this Chromebook. First and most challenging, it runs too slowly. I'm not asking for a gaming machine or even streaming video, but it lags even on simple websites (news, email, social media). An efficient and responsive browser is the most important thing in a Chromebook and this doesn't have it. The keyboard is also a challenge. The left Shift key and the Return key are both squished annoyingly. A lifetime of getting used to keyboards runs up against the weird configuration of these two important keys. Rest of the keyboard isn't squished at all so it's even more noticeable and irritating. Battery life seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY ASUS!!!
customer_reviews.text: A TOTAL RIP OFF. I checked with ASUS before I bought this and was told THREE times this model worked with Google Play Store android apps. After multiple calls to ASUS they finally said sorry it doesn't and did not offer any replacement or return or exchange. Thankfully AMAZON stood behind their products and let me return it. NEVER will buy ASUS products again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Chromebooks are actually kind of cool
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about getting a Chromebook for the longest time, especially as my go-to personal laptop thingy was an Asus Eee 1005HA that's about five years old and still going strong with amazing build quality. This Chromebook seems to have the same famous build quality, along with a battery life that's at least twice as long, a processor twice as fast, slightly larger screen, only half the power consumption, etc. While watching netflix at full brightness, this Chromebook consumes 4.2W. My netbook does not have the power to run Netflix, but on absolute lowest power settings with the screen off, it still consumes 7.6W. I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Using this right now to right the review. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Using this right now to right the review. It works well and is very snappy, battery lasts an entire day. Only downside is the weird power connector, wish it was a standard USB of some sort.
customer_reviews.author: Kevins

customer_reviews.title: The description was honest, but left out important details
customer_reviews.text: The condition was as stated, 5 stars. The fact that it is not capable of downloading anything from the google play store makes it useless to me, since I cannot install ANYTHING on this laptop. It’s purpose is for school, and I need to use Microsoft office products, not google docs, and install a few other apps. That would have been nice to know and a very important detail left out of the description.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: ... gigs of RAM) - this thing is snappy and wonderful in comparison
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Chromebook as an upgrade from my old Toshiba Chromebook 2 (with 2 gigs of RAM) - this thing is snappy and wonderful in comparison! It handles multitasking with ease, and Netflix works really well on it as well. The speakers aren't the loudest, but given that it's a tiny Chromebook, I'm not going to judge it too harshly and if I want to have loud video/audio, there's always casting things via the Chromecast to my TV. The screen quality is great, and I really like the small form factor too - it's not too small to type on, but not too big to just toss into my purse or backpack and go!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Lynn Nolen

customer_reviews.title: No more laggy laptops
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Chromebook for a while. I love it and use it daily. Great battery life. Very quick to respond, no lagging. With Google docs and the cloud, I don't see a reason for a PC. I used to have a MacBook but this is so light and quick that it's the only thing I use. I don't have a need for a CD drive so this is perfect at an unbelievable price!
customer_reviews.author: MelTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good small student chromebook,  like red/gold color,  but don't recommend for games sorry
customer_reviews.text: Great for student and doing school work, it's a great little chromebook, really liked the size for backpack ! But if you are trying to play games on it I would not recommend it at all sorry, but still great student chromebook , really liked the red/lotus gold fade too, price was good just don't buy to game on it is all, cool small chromebook though
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Chromebooks are lightweight and easy to use, and this is a good one.
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight, quick, and easy. Perfect for travel, or web browsing. I love the color scheme. A word of caution about Chromebooks in general - they can't connect to my printer (this shocked me, as I bought that printer in 2017) and they don't seem able to handle any browser other than Chrome - I've had issues with one or two websites where tech support recommended trying a different browser and I was unable to do that on this device. But I still enjoy the convenience of a Chromebook, and I like this one in particular.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn J Albert

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but everything looks blue
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great Chromebook. I have been using it for a while now and it has worked well for my intended use. The only two things I dislike about it is the camera and the blueish tint to the screen. The camera is very grainy, but I can get over that as I was expecting that at this price point. The screen however is another story. It has a bluish tint to the screen and no way to adjust it. So if you are looking at pictures of people they all look like Smurf's.
customer_reviews.author: JBP

customer_reviews.title: The cover frame cracked open
customer_reviews.text: Amazing device upon arrival and no complaint for a year and a half until it just popped open a few days ago, pieces of plastic flying off its cover frame exposing a metallic hinge desperately trying to keep it all together. I just read that others have had this problem so I feel reassured that it wasn't due to neglect on my part but rather cheap plastic parts. Additionally, the frame popping was so extreme that a wire snapped and it now won't connect to the Internet at all. Judging by the previous reviews, it's not worth trying to get it fixed so I'll be looking for another device elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Public name

customer_reviews.title: Actually I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: Actually I like it a lot. I have a high-end surface book as my main labtop, and I am looking for a low-end labtop to suffice my basic surfing need because carrying a surface book can be sometime a heavy job for your shoulders. For this labtop, I did not expect too much. Considering its price, it is a good product to buy and meets my need. It is not prefect though, yet it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mingxi Liu

customer_reviews.title: Compact and light but typing problems
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something light, convenient to pack up, and also easy to type. This product definitely fulfilled the first 2 criteria but was incredibly frustrating to type for longer than a quick message. Specifically, there was a lag between when I pressed the "caps lock" button (which you have to change the "search" button to in the settings) and when I pressed my next letter key such that the words would come out loOKing lIKe tHIS. I'm looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Dog mother

customer_reviews.title: a Chromebook is your best option. If you are looking for a no-frills ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a simple computer used mainly for browsing and emailing, a Chromebook is your best option. If you are looking for a no-frills Chromebook that delivers the basic functionalities and looks good while having great mobility in lightness of frame and compactness in size, this is a great choice. As with all Chromebooks, it starts up instantly and runs smoothly. Size-wise, the keyboard is full-size and provides a great experience in typing with fully responsive keys, and has a track pad that is better than those found on most other laptops. Overall, very satisfied with this product for what it gives you, and the low price is a plus as well.
customer_reviews.author: YU FAMILY

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and simple chromebook! Stylish, too!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for someone getting used to internet usage. I knew a chromebook would offer the ease of navigating a laptop without all those unnecessary programs for a new user. The feedback I got was that the laptop was very fast! Very happy I found this affordable chromebook!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love my Chromebook c201
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Chromebook c201! Light, slim, and slick looking. clear picture, fast response. It does take a little getting use to doing everything from the browser but not a big deal at all. I use VMware VDI (Virtual Desktop Infrastructure) to connect to work and it works like a charm. I can access my docs from google drive, print from google print. I watch HBOGO, Netflix, I read from Amazon Cloud and Google Books. My only issue is getting the micro HDMI to work for my monitor and NBApass for live games. Archive video works but not live game. I got far more for the money. Love my Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like it! Super light weight
customer_reviews.text: I really like it! Super light weight. Fast. Fell off a counter and cracked the corner, but it didn't affect the function AT ALL. So, heart attack avoided. 4 stars because the volume doesn't get loud enough to hear people talking on Netflix while I cook.
customer_reviews.author: EcoMamaSue

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice google chrome book
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice google chrome book. I use Apple but this one is nice for when I need to google something. 8 seconds start to internet service. Wow. I love this. My apple was available in 45 seconds but the last two upgrades were down loads and not a disc donthe start time is 1:43 seconds now. Ouch. JDE
customer_reviews.author: James D. Elton

customer_reviews.title: Great for internet only use
customer_reviews.text: My mom loves online shopping. Like really lives it...its her life. I've always been asus fan, they've always lasted long and held up well. Works well and good price. So when her hp died I just bought her this. She literally only used the internet, and that's all this has. No apps, no Microsoft word office etc, no calculator, games, wallpapers....nothing. just Google chrome. My mom loves how fast it works and how simple (one thing to click)it is. Can't beat the cost and being asus I know it'll last
customer_reviews.author: katie h

customer_reviews.title: "Light Blue -ish"
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly what I wanted. Small, light, email, calendars, internet and documents. My only complaint is the color. All of the photos would lead you to believe that it is a blue. Maybe even a little metallic.... the opposite is true. Not metallic, more of a flat plastic look and I would struggle to call it "light blue " . There is a teal or green or something in the blue. If I saw it in person first I would have bought a different color, but I don't hate it enough to send back.
customer_reviews.author: clinton

customer_reviews.title: ... my daughter to use at school and it was perfect. It is affordable and portable
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase for my daughter to use at school and it was perfect. It is affordable and portable. She is able to stay connected to her teachers and classrooms whether at home or at school. It has plenty of memory and even a nice "look". It does exactly what we need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bates

customer_reviews.title: A real hit in our house
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 7 year old who loves watching youtube videos. I purchased it solely for the color options and great reviews. We have had it for one week now and it seems like a pretty good buy. I really like the keyboard, battery life, and how lightweight it is. We've charged it only once in 6 days. My daughter only complained that the color discription is gold/red and it's actually silver/red. I think we both use it equally. I'm not sure that I would ever buy a Windows product again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook concept sustained and upgraded - remains a fine value
customer_reviews.text: Joins an ACER 11" chromebook that is still heavily used into its 7th year but is showing its age in some keyboard keys not working so well. The first ASUS arrived without a touchpad [not found by system] but its replacement is what I had hoped it would be. The keyboard is more limited but one can find key combinations to replace those. Battery life goes well beyond a workday of use as a thin-client. Its 4G of memory doubles the other chromebook's and seems a noticeable improvement. Has micro HDMI output which would require cable purchase and has not been tried. It has no ethernet connectivity though usb ethernet can be used.
customer_reviews.author: pilliwinks

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 2nd travel computer, good for work
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful travel computer. I have Mac book air but this is PERFECT for travel in remote areas or backpacking though various countries. It is a small investment and getting it stolen would be a minimal problem. Key board is nice and easy typing, have used it to keep up with work while in various countries throughout SE asia. Battery Life is FANTASTIC. I love the tiny charger (much less to cary). VERY thin, very light. tiny bit thicker than some tablets and is much easier to get actual work done.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor guy

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This is our first Chromebook. I am a power-user of my computer, therefore I was a bit skeptical at first. After considering how my kids use a computer (YouTube, Games, and maybe Homework on occassion) I decided to look into the different Chromebooks and price points. It seemed like a good value for their needs and after a couple of weeks, it has replaced the iPad and iPhone as the go to entertainment source. Sturdy and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A Brack

customer_reviews.title: First one did not work second one seems to be doing OK
customer_reviews.text: I received a laptop and it started out working fine.... after the third time turning it on the Chrome OS was missing or damaged. This is always scary so instead of attempting to fix it I traded it back to Amazon. Thank you Amazon for having my back on this, that 5 star service. 1 star for a laptop that broke after having it for merely a week. Three stars for the ease of getting a new one. No problems on the new one yet... Let's hope it was just a one off.
customer_reviews.author: Kris T.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made in awhile
customer_reviews.text: This is the best purchase I've made in a long time. It's perfect. It boots up quickly, runs smoothly, and it's crazy light. For something so inexpensive it feels very well-constructed, especially the keyboard. I use it daily. I've been really surprised at how much I enjoy using this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Justinwr

customer_reviews.title: It is a decent option for this price.
customer_reviews.text: I used this chromebook for a month and there are a few things I want to share: Pros: Lightweight and the size of this laptop is perfect for carrying around school The battery lasts for 2 days and I actually used it a lot. The speed of web browsing is faster than expected. Cons: The touchpad feels very cheap and isn’t responsive. After about 2 weeks, one of the touchpad corner was broken. The keyboard also wasn’t working properly sometimes. After all, if keyboard and touchpad doesn’t bother you as much, this chrome-book is a good option to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquel DeVinck

customer_reviews.title: Great for Casual Web Browsing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly for casual web browsing to replace an old iPad. I still use an actual laptop for gaming, programming, and whatever else requires heavier operating systems to function. I use this Chromebook for things like Facebook, school work, Reddit, Amazon, etc. I love how lightweight and portable it is, and how quickly it starts up. The webcam is not the best quality, but I wouldn't expect it to be at this price. Overall I think it was a great purchase and would recommend it for casual web use!
customer_reviews.author: Jamesy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Only been using it for a few hours and i freaking love it. i had a samsung chromebook that my husband so kindly stepped on with his steel toe boots. i got an hp to replace it and i couldnt stand it for more than a few minutes. did my research and found this bad boy and ill never go back. it runs smoothly. i usually have upwards 5 tabs open, music playing, skype going and it doesnt hesistate at all. it runs a lot better than the samsung chromebook too! i loooove it!
customer_reviews.author: Lynnae L.

customer_reviews.title: A Lovely Wee Friend
customer_reviews.text: For getting online and doing everything in the cloud, this little guy is great. It's lightweight, resistant to scuffing, fits into my purse as easily as a computer bag, and holds a decent charge. My quibbles are all with the OS, so if you're not familiar with how the Chrome operating system operates, do some research on that first. The hardware here is right on.
customer_reviews.author: B. Proczko

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing deal for anyone looking for a device that features ...
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up at $169 for sports journalism purposes. Absolutely amazing deal for anyone looking for a device that features full size keys for typing, the ability to connect to the internet and create word documents and the ability to download photos from a camera. I've seen a bunch of colleagues using $1,000 Macbooks and similarly priced laptops for the same purposes. If all you need is a device for basic content creation, look no further. The quad core Chinese processor flies and, hey, it may not be Intel, but even if the thing burns out in two years, (not that I expect it to) at the price it's almost disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Zyla

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Except the speakers :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost a year ago and it's been pretty great in standing the test of time. The one major downfall to this computer is the volume on it. It's almost a joke, if you're watching something and you chuckle lightly, you won't be able to hear whatever it was you lightly chuckled over. BUT for the price, it's hard to beat. It's very very fast, battery lasts for such a long time, you can go a week or more without charging it. So great. I'd still buy a chromebook again but maybe look for one with a bit more volume.
customer_reviews.author: satmary

customer_reviews.title: Liking the Chromebook more and more...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I am learning much about Chromebook applications. Gotta hand it to Google for adding applications daily! I have learned to download and use many of the apps that I was concerned about to view offline. I just wish Amazon would update the Audible program application to work with the Chromebook (someday soon, I hope ... I still can't get it to work properly even on my android Moto phone either, but I suspect it is not a Google issue). Am impressed with the Chromebooks speed :)
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Top product
customer_reviews.text: The best, I put my windows laptop on the side and work on my Chromebook, top !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R. Coombes

customer_reviews.title: This has worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a Mac user but it was getting time for a new computer and I didn't want to drop the huge amount of money needed to buy a new macbook. I started googling chromebooks and came upon this one. I needed something light I could take to Japan with me for 3 months. This has worked great for me. It is very easy to use and I already use Google for mostly everything so this chromebook was perfect. It is no Mac of course but for the incredibly price I don't see anything to complain about. It does exactly what I need it to do and it does it well. I'm happy I stumbled upon it.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary S

customer_reviews.title: Love this Chromebook!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for months now and I love it! It's small, FAST, and does everything I need it to do. The battery will last for days with moderate use and a day with heavy use. It doesn't feel cheap or flimsy, but isn't heavy. The camera isn't the best, but it works well for video chat. Every so often I'll use it to build/update websites, and it doesn't appear to be that much slower than my desk top. I highly recommend this Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: S. PatrickTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted! Super lightweight and stylish.
customer_reviews.text: I have a gaming laptop and wanted an inexpensive secondary one for school/portability. This is perfect. As others have said, the smaller keyboard does take getting used to but the keys feel good and once I get used to it I think it will be fine. One note, other reviews have mentioned that it is annoying that there is a search button where the capslock key usually is, but you can actually go into Settings and change this veeeery simply, in Keyboard Settings. I've yet to test the battery life, so I can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Kc

customer_reviews.title: Seller would not respond
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this I loved it but it lasted 3 months I tried to get a replacement but nobody responded! I’m going through all orders I’ve made in last few years and this one really irritates me because nobody cared to even try and make it right
customer_reviews.author: shannajlee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Great Chromebook fast great color and great price also the battery life is amazing I use it from when I wake up till the time I go to bed and only have to charge it when I go to bed this is the best Chromebook in my opion for the price thanks ASUS
customer_reviews.author: J Scharnagel

customer_reviews.title: Basic and Good.
customer_reviews.text: It's a chromebook so the annoyances I have with it isn't due to tech issues but just annoying chromebook features like the back button, lack of CAP button, etc. little things like that annoy me. Other than that it is a fine little gadget. Small and compact, holds its charge and battery life is fine. It's very basic but that's all I needed it for. Idk if I'd ever get a chromebook again because of the design (like CAP, etc.) but it does what it says it will so I give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: DuffY

customer_reviews.title: I liked a chrome book
customer_reviews.text: I have an Acer chromebook. After a 1.5-2 years it started giving me problems and screws started falling out of the bottom. I liked a chrome book, so I decided to buy this ASUS: it looked nice and weight was low in description. In fact it exceeded my expectations. It is very light, pretty much like iPad, sleek, looks really pretty in white and blue colors, works perfectly, very fast and easy to use. I recommend it for those who need Windows type system and Google Chrome. Some features in chromebooks are not available, like PDF reader, but one can download PDF converter.
customer_reviews.author: R. M.

customer_reviews.title: A Lemon product! Not recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: The machine is a lemon product. First, I need to push the power button several times to turn on the machine. 2nd, no sound in most of time from the machine. Totally unreliable product. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: W. Yang

customer_reviews.title: useful Chromebook but it's a good value (or was when ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for a while now, and dropped it at least half a dozen times and it's still working flawlessly. It's your typical cheap, small, useful Chromebook but it's a good value (or was when I bought it). I would shop for something a little more updated if buying a Chromebook today, but I would also look to see if there's a more recent version of this product.
customer_reviews.author: JLK

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful product!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely versatile and powerful! I bought it in hopes of having a cheap computer and reliable computer for college and it has surprised me ever since. The battery life on this is incredible. I could do my research, type reports for the entire day and I would still have around 50% left. I once left it on standby for 2 weeks and the battery was still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Ng

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is super light--only flaw not loud enough..
customer_reviews.text: The only flaw of this chromebook is that the volume cannot be turned up very high. You can watch a movie if there is no one else in the room--if there is any background noise whatsoever you will not be able to hear it. Otherwise, a very useful machine for accessing anything at all on the net. It was important to me that it be light, and I have still not seen anything lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Estherfan

customer_reviews.title: Light with great battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Basic laptop. Cant really do anything other than surf the web. If you live in the Google world then this is a great device for online. Its not like a pc where you can install apps like a traditional laptop, etc. For music streaming and web surfing this is a great device. Battery life is excellent. Would recommend for a light alternative.
customer_reviews.author: lostintheamazon

customer_reviews.title: Great 2nd computer
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this little computer. For the majority of us, everything we do is on the web; email, Facebook, Netflix, Amazon. This thing wool do it like a champ. And, with Google cloud storage, their Docs and spreadsheets that work off line, very rarely do I find myself in a situation this won't do well. And with the size, it is actually a laptop you can put on top of your lap. Great 2nd computer
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Worked beautifully but not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Worked beautifully but not what I was looking for. I like to download Spotify to listen to music you can’t do that in chrome books. They are very limiting. The computer was great but it was just not what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: cinthia moran

customer_reviews.title: The Chromebook to Beat
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth Chromebook, and by far my favorite. It is slim, has a great screen, fast boot up time, and is fast enough to do my daily tasks on. To me if you are looking for an 11.6" chromebook, this is the one to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Chrome OS malfunctions.
customer_reviews.text: It lasted exactly a year and now shows the "Chrome OS is missing or damaged." Did everything the chrome recovery site says to do, looked through tons of IT forums and still it says "unexpected error try again". Ridiculous. I loooooved my Chromebook for the year I had it, but realistically it's just not a good investment if no one can fix its random malfunctions. I was hoping it would last me three or four years. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is incredible! Faster than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth between a tablet and a Chromebook, but I'm really happy with this purchase! I use this for basic web browsing and streaming Netflix and video. Its much snappier than I imagined and the battery life is incredible. They aren't joking when they say it lasts up to 13 hours, just plug it in at night and it will last all day! I wouldn't suggest a Chromebook as your only computer, but as a backup and portable device its great. I find myself using this to browse the web over my laptop now do to how light it is and how long the battery lasts.
customer_reviews.author: -Dan-

customer_reviews.title: I use this for Mobile work great little laptop
customer_reviews.text: Was Perfect for me. I am a Realtor so I need on the go laptop that I can print from. This is perfect sized I only need it for internet stuff and its fast. FYI Chromebooks only work with HP printers. I bought a cheap portable printer and you plug it in and works great. If you need a small laptop with no apps or programs just internet searching and printing this is for you. Has some UBS ports.
customer_reviews.author: Tara B

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this Chromebook. Thin, light, great keyboard. Great battery life. Looks handsome. And I am very pleased with all the things I can do within the Chrome browser. So far, no limitations. For some, not being able to install software might be a show stopper. But I can edit audio files online, as well as other types of activity. I like keeping all my stuff in the cloud, so it's accessible even if I am using my wife's or my kid's laptop. The only thing I might do differently next time is to get a 13" screen, but 12" is acceptable. And of course, the great price.
customer_reviews.author: Irving Cantor

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant buying this because I'm used to spending a thousand on MacBooks but this laptop is so worth it! It works almost as well as a MacBook, and obviously it won't be as good but it really is a great laptop for someone who doesn't want to spend too much money. Personally, my favorite part of it is that ombré keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Sarker H.

customer_reviews.title: Keys on the keyboard just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for Christmas last year. He used it off and on and immediately I noticed a ton of pop ups and ads that would shut down the whole computer. He started to use it heavily in September when school started. It's required for school and he needs it every day. Not even one year of use later and now some of the keys on the keyboard won't work. Asus won't help me since it's a year and two weeks since I purchased the product which means it's out of warranty (regardless of the fact that it hasn't been in use for a full year). You definitely get what you pay for with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Rhoda

customer_reviews.title: New to Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to technology ... I do have my limitations, but with the help of two books from Amazon the transition is going smoothly. The Chromebook is meeting my expectations for travel. I can have my account and my wife can have hers ...on the same machine with little or no hassle. When we visit friends, I don't like to use their computers ... now we can connect to their Wi-Fi and have the privacy we have at our home. Understanding the ins and outs of Google is a challenge, however, the authors of the above books both claim I will like Google better than Windows 10. I did add an Amazon Wireless Mouse and an extra charging cord.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: battery life is great and just all around it's a good working chrome ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it's been a month, battery life is great and just all around it's a good working chrome book and it gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro

customer_reviews.title: Great Until -
customer_reviews.text: Chrome crashed. I can't get it to reboot Chrome. It's dead. Regardless of what I do, it won't reboot. All I was doing is reviewing a web page the instructor recommended. It lasted one year. ... It had a great battery, it was easy to use. But for it to only last 1 year, well - not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DeltaGal

customer_reviews.title: It has been perfect for her
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter has been using this for more than a year. It has been perfect for her. We have had no problems with it and she has put in 100s of hours of use on it, maybe even 1000s. That kid has had an ongoing love affair with Netflix that has been a bit disturbing.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Haldeman

customer_reviews.title: This computer is fine for light web browsing
customer_reviews.text: This computer is fine for light web browsing, and usually can handle things like netflix and youtube. However, it's painfully slow most of the time. Some things I've noticed: - Javascript is painfully slow - Bluetooth speakers cause the computer to lag and sound/video no longer match - screen resolution isn't great On the bright side, it's small, light, cheap, and has a crazy good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: AKS

customer_reviews.title: don't like this chrombook
customer_reviews.text: This chrombook has lots of issues, and when I go to the forum I see all the problems listed that I have had. Chrome doesn't offer Flash or Java, Battery icon disappeared, settings are unneccesarily complex. I am only keeping because it's too much trouble to return and try to get my money back.Should have spent a little more money and got a real laptop.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sanshu

customer_reviews.title: Great for students!
customer_reviews.text: As a nursing student, I was worried about having to lug this around and carry all of my books. This laptop is so light. I forget that it is there most of the time. The battery life is INSANE. I don't ever have to worry about sitting next to a charging port as soon as I use it because I get 8-10 hours easily out of its battery. I am so pleased with the graphics and its ability to keep up with my 5-6 windows that I leave open for notes, music and websites. I have no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: Like the size and am still getting used to my first chromebook. The type on the keyboard can be difficult to see in low light, which bothers me. I am having difficulty loading google apps even though I am fully loaded with the latest tech. I enjoy the light weight and the racey color. The battery life seems good and the screen is a nice size but does not have the brightest screen. This book was a very good price for the secondary computer that I needed but would not use this for a primary laptop. Stick with windows.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: i think it is great as a small portable computer - getting use to ...
customer_reviews.text: i think it is great as a small portable computer - getting use to Chrome as an OS is something. Use to using Window based business software so it is a major change for me. For non business travel it will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: It works great, easy to set up, that’s the gist of it!
customer_reviews.text: I won’t pretend to be tech savvy and leave a thorough review breaking down every minute detail of this chromebook because there’s enough reviews on here doing just that. It works great, it’s easy to set up, and worth every penny I paid for it. That’s all I have to say, hope it’s helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for money
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is amazing. I don't even have to think about it most of the times. It is light and portable and the keyboard works well. The drawbacks are that chrome OS is very much internet based, so if you're not connected to the internet there isn't much to do. Also, the speakers are pretty soft but with headphones it's an easy fix. Overall I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ASUS C201 11.6 Inch Chromebook (Rockchip, 4 GB, 16GB SSD, Pearl White/Light Blue)
product_meta.description: Style:Chromebook only| Color:Pearl White/Light BlueASUS Chromebook, C201PA-DS02-PW, 11.6 inches 1366768 pixels LED-lit Screen, Rockchip 1.8 GHz Processor, 4GB DDR3 Memory, 16GB EMMC, Intel HD, Chrome OS, HD Camera, Bluetooth 4.0, Chiclet Keyboard, Pearl White
feature_bullets: 11.6­inch 1366 by 768 glossy HD display for vivid high definition image quality
Up to 13 hours of battery life
802.11ac wireless for up to 3 times faster wireless speeds
Trusted Platform Module (TPM) security for protection of sensitive information.Spacious touchpad for effortless navigation and control; NOTE: Check User Manual on Technical Specification before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,339 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
